title.rendered: “IDF, Shin Bet and Border Police Arrest Nine Suspects, Destroy Explosives in Judea and Samaria: An Overnight Operation Detailed”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF, Shin Bet, and the Border Police arrested nine wanted individuals last night across Judea and Samaria; explosives intended to harm our forces were destroyed in Balata in Nablus.

Overnight, the IDF, Shin Bet, and the Border Police arrested nine individuals desired in various locations in Judea and Samaria.

In Balata in Nablus, the soldiers identified and destroyed several explosive devices that were located along an axis in the area and were intended to harm our troops.

In the city of Hebron, in Eizone village in the Ephraim Brigade, and in al Ma’azra in the Etzion Brigade, the troops arrested four wanted individuals, two of whom are suspected of inciting terror. In the Binyamin Brigade, the forces arrested a wanted individual and also confiscated a Kalashnikov type rifle.

The arrested individuals and confiscated weapons were handed over for further processing by security forces. Our forces were not injured.

Since the beginning of the war, about 3,500 individuals have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley and Valleys Brigade, over 1,500 of them are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

Attached are images of the troops in action: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC19032024.1561898
